item.title: Coronavirus: UK becomes first country in Europe to pass 30,000 deaths
item.description: The UK records a further 649 deaths, taking the total number of coronavirus deaths to 30,076.

item.title: Coronavirus: Boris Johnson 'bitterly regrets' care home crisis
item.description: The PM says government is "working hard" to tackle it - and sets 200,000 test aim by end of month.

item.title: Coronavirus: Germany reopens shops as lockdown is relaxed
item.description: Angela Merkel says "the very first phase is behind us" as the coronavirus lockdown is eased.

item.title: New Banksy artwork appears at Southampton hospital
item.description: The piece depicts a young boy discarding his superhero toys in favour of a model of an NHS nurse.

item.title: Kraftwerk founder Florian Schneider dies at 73
item.description: The German quartet set the template for electronic music and influenced scores of other artists.

item.title: Coronavirus: Trump says virus task force to focus on reopening economy
item.description: The president says it will focus on reopening the economy, a day after indicating it may be disbanded.

item.title: Police officer attacked during West Hendon chase
item.description: A man is held on suspicion of attempted murder after an officer is seriously assaulted, police say.

item.title: Coronavirus: Neil Ferguson to face no police action for 'undermining' lockdown
item.description: Scotland Yard says Prof Neil Ferguson's behaviour was "plainly disappointing" but rules out fining him.

item.title: Coronavirus: Heathrow trialling passenger temperature checks
item.description: Heathrow boss urges government to help his industry saying restarting aviation is key to restarting UK economy as a whole.

item.title: Coronavirus: Ministers launch hardship fund for dairy farmers
item.description: Demand for milk has dropped with the closure of cafes and restaurants during the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: Coronavirus: Debenhams to close five stores after lockdown ends
item.description: Debenhams will permanently close more stores, after failing to agree new terms with some landlords.

item.title: Coronavirus mutations: Scientists puzzle over impact
item.description: A study has identified a mutation that its authors say could make the coronavirus more infectious.

item.title: Tom Cruise: Filming in space and four of his other memorable stunts
item.description: The actor is well known for his daring stunts, but this takes things to another level.

item.title: Baby Archie: Duchess of Sussex reads to son to mark his first birthday
item.description: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex release a video of their son to celebrate his first birthday.

item.title: Coronavirus: Photographers' children's lives in lockdown
item.description: Photographers who work for Unicef have taken candid shots of their children's lives during lockdown.

item.title: VE Day: The experience of a Caribbean WW2 RAF veteran
item.description: Albert Jarrett was among some 10,000 West Indians who crossed the Atlantic to join the war effort.

item.title: Grimes and Elon Musk's X Æ A-12 (and 8 other unusual celebrity baby names)
item.description: Grimes and Elon Musk's first child together is hardly the first unusual celebrity baby name.

item.title: Coronavirus: How long it takes to recover
item.description: Weeks, months, even a year - we look at the factors that can affect the time taken to get better.

item.title: Coronavirus: Inclusive choir finds voice in lockdown
item.description: The Soundabout Inclusive Choir is helping to overcome the isolation felt by some people with special needs.

item.title: New Twilight book: 'Fans grew up with criticism of the originals'
item.description: It's been 12 years since we last got to read about the lives of Edward Cullen and Bella Swan.

item.title: Coronavirus lockdown: I got a life-changing opportunity
item.description: Ana Carmona was quarantined with her parents and siblings in NYC, when she got some big news.

item.title: Coronavirus: Brecon RFC signs flock of sheep to cut grass
item.description: Brecon RFC enlist the woolly herd as the team's head groundsman is self-isolating.

item.title: Captain Tom Moore receives gold Blue Peter badge
item.description: The 100-year-old fundraiser joins the Queen and David Attenborough in receiving the accolade.

item.title: In pictures: Fun for all the family at Butlin's
item.description: Photographer Barry Lewis captures the spirit of a Butlin's holiday camp in 1982.

item.title: Coronavirus: How might lockdown end and what will be the 'new normal'?
item.description: When the government eases restrictions, how will social and work life be different?

item.title: How Florian Schneider and Kraftwerk influenced five decades of music
item.description: The band's influence can be heard in everything from art-rock and hip-hop to trance and house.

item.title: Coronavirus: Why did the UK need 100,000 tests a day?
item.description: What are the tests for coronavirus, who are they for and how do they work?

item.title: Coronavirus UK map: How many confirmed cases are there in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.

item.title: Coronavirus in Scotland: A 'difficult day' on the Covid frontline
item.description: The BBC's James Cook spends a day with doctors and nurses dealing with coronavirus in hospital.

item.title: The Aces: 'We were told not to sing about girls'
item.description: The indie-pop band were told to hide their sexuality but their second album joyfully defies the advice.

item.title: Coronavirus: Are dentists open for emergency care? And other questions
item.description: Are dentists open for emergency care, and other questions answered by BBC experts.

item.title: Coronavirus schools return: Can you really keep children 2m apart?
item.description: What's it like in a school that has re-opened? Denmark and Germany show how it might look.

item.title: The patients who just can't shake off Covid-19
item.description: Most patients recover from Covid-19 quickly - but for some, symptoms linger for weeks.

item.title: Can you compare the UK with Italy on virus death tolls?
item.description: The UK has passed Italy's death toll but it's hard to make direct comparisons.

item.title: Coronavirus: I watched the president reveal I had Covid-19 on TV
item.description: Against her will, Sita Tyasutami became "case one", the face of Indonesia's coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: Coronavirus: Sailors tell of months stuck on ships
item.description: Since March, many ports are refusing to allow crew changes or shore leave.

item.title: German Bundesliga to resume this month
item.description: Chancellor Angela Merkel confirms the German Bundesliga season can resume this month.

item.title: Trash-talking Tony Bellew gets thrashed at Fifa by Michael Obafemi
item.description: Trash-talking Tony Bellew gets thrashed by Michael Obafemi in the second day of the Premier League invitational Fifa tournament.

item.title: Premier League season could be cancelled if clubs don't back neutral venues - LMA boss
item.description: The 2019-20 Premier League season could be cancelled if clubs do not agree to play in neutral venues, says LMA chief executive Richard Bevan.

item.title: England bad at penalties? Think again - say the Germans
item.description: New scientific research, from Germany of all places, suggests English footballers are actually good at spot-kicks.

item.title: Thursday's gossip: Man Utd want to sign Ighalo permanently
item.description: Man Utd want to make striker Odion Ighalo's loan deal permanent, plus more

item.title: 'I love the battle, I have no fear' - Bess on England, the Ashes and enjoying on-field backchat
item.description: Dom Bess talks about England, the Ashes and why he looks up to Australia's Nathan Lyon.

item.title: Climate change: Could the coronavirus crisis spur a green recovery?
item.description: Some governments want to channel their economic recovery plans into low-carbon industries.

item.title: Climate change and coronavirus: Five charts about the biggest carbon crash
item.description: How the global pandemic is limiting carbon emissions and what this will mean for climate change.

item.title: How the Covid-19 pandemic is threatening Africa’s wildlife
item.description: Park rangers in Africa say the closure of safari tourism is leading to an increase in poaching.

item.title: What is climate change? A really simple guide
item.description: BBC News looks at what we know and don't know about the Earth's changing climate.

item.title: Coronavirus and climate change a ‘double crisis’
item.description: Many activists have had to stop their usual work due to the pandemic. Here's how they're responding.

item.title: Emotional abuse: ‘My fiance seemed perfect - but he wanted to control me’
item.description: An actress who became engaged to an older and more successful actor, describes six months of emotional abuse.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'I never thought I'd be so proud to sell bread and butter'
item.description: Laura McLellan felt humbled when she and her team of checkout operators were told they were key workers.

item.title: 'Nobody told us about the coronavirus pandemic'
item.description: Before setting sail around the world, Elena and Ryan told their families not to give them bad news.

item.title: Coronavirus: Protecting the 'one in a million' girl
item.description: Bex Price's family went into isolation early as coronavirus would almost certainly kill her.

item.title: Coronavirus: Making face masks feels 'like the war effort'
item.description: Thousands of people are producing cloth masks, despite UK authorities saying they are unnecessary.

item.title: Coronavirus journey: The 'last cruise ship on Earth' finally comes home
item.description: From political storms to presidential pleas, it has been quite a journey for the MSC Magnifica.

item.title: The tiny premature baby who fought off coronavirus
item.description: Peyton Maguire from Lanarkshire is one of the youngest Covid-19 patients in the UK.

item.title: How Typhoid Mary left a trail of scandal and death
item.description: The chilling story of an Irish immigrant cook who brought typhoid to well-to-do families in New York.

item.title: Coronavirus: Grandmas' top tips to get through lockdown
item.description: We've asked Grannies from around the world for their advice on staying positive.

item.title: A coronavirus survivor's story: 'I touched death'
item.description: Elizabeth says she feels lucky to be alive after falling seriously ill with the virus.

item.title: Coronavirus: Wacky and wonderful scrubs for NHS workers
item.description: Hundreds of volunteers are making scrubs of all different designs and colours for doctors and nurses.
